Define Schema with Direct Parameter Specification

Source: R/tool.R
schema.Rd

Create a schema definition by directly specifying parameters, as an alternative to using function annotations with as_schema(). Same syntax as tool() but semantically represents an output schema rather than a tool.

Usage

schema(name, description, ...)

Arguments

name

Character. The schema name

description

Character. What the schema represents

...

Named parameter specifications. See tool() for syntax details.

Value

A list with name, description, and args_schema fields.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Simple schema
user_schema <- schema(
  name = "user_response",
  description = "User information",
  name = "string* User's full name",
  age = "integer* User's age"
)

# Nested schema
detailed_schema <- schema(
  name = "user_detailed",
  description = "Detailed user information",
  name = "string*",
  address = list(
    type = "object",
    street = "string",
    city = "string"
  )
)
} # }
